metadata.title: CVE-2020-25645 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel in versions before 5.9-rc7. Trafficbetween two Geneve endpoints may be unencrypted when IPsec is configured toencrypt traffic for the specific UDP port used by the GENEVE tunnelallowing anyone between the two endpoints to read the traffic unencrypted.The main threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-lowlatency - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-197-lowlatency - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1082-aws - 4.4.0-1082.86
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1100-azure - 4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1082.86').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1').
